text:
Actor Patty Duke dies at 69

Actor and singer Patty Duke, who won an Oscar at age 16 for her portrayal of deaf-blind political activist Helen Keller in The Miracle Worker , died on Tuesday. She was 69.

Duke built on her success by playing “identical cousins” in her own sitcom, The Patty Duke Show , which ran for more than 100 episodes in the mid-1960s.

Duke, whose real name was Anna Pearce, had developed sepsis from a ruptured intestine, her manager Mitchell Stubbs said in a statement. Her son actor Sean Astin, who played hobbit Samwise Gamgee in Peter Jackson’s The Lord of the Rings trilogy, said the family were celebrating the “infinite love and compassion she shared through her work and throughout her life”. — AFP
title: Los Angeles, March 29, 2016 (AFP)
